conbody.p: When you are editing a pageflow or a workflow diagram, the menu name Diagram can be found in the menu bar. The Diagram menu name provides a drop-down list to access different functions and features. These functions and features are enabled or disabled depending on the tasks you are performing.
The drop-down list in the Diagram menu contains:

strow.stentry: Font
Sets the type, face, style, size, and color of the text for States and Transitions that you selected.
Fill Color
Sets the color for View and Sub-page flow States that you selected.
Line Color
Sets the line color for View and Sub-pageflow States that you selected.
Line Style
Sets the line style for Transitions that you selected.
Select All

Lets you:
Highlight all items in the active diagram.
Highlight all shapes in the active diagram.
Highlight all connectors in the active diagram.
Arrange All
Arranges items in the active diagram into a proper layout.
Align
Aligns a group of selected items.
Order
Lets you order the display of States when overlapping occurs.
Auto Size
Resizes the selected States to the default size.
Make Same Size
Resizes the States that you selected to the same size as the last State (known as the reference state) that you selected.
View

Displays grid lines, rulers, or page breaks in the active diagram that is displayed in the Editor area. If grid lines are displayed, the Snap to Grid option lets you align the placement of elements to the vertical and horizontal grid lines.
Zoom
Changes the displayed size of the active diagram in the Editor area.
Apply/Appearance Properties
Copies the appearance properties of the first selected item in the active diagram to other items in the diagram.
Validate

Updates the information in the Problems view pane when the information does not automatically reflect the changes that were made to the diagram. This function forces the run of the validation process, which updates the Problem view pane.
